Q: How can I do parallel builds in Maven? A:

Some of the CI build applications (e.g., Hudson) can build multiple Maven projects at the same time (and even on multiple machines).

Support for this in Maven 'standalone' would also be nice. A quick look through the Maven issue tracker gave me this.

Q: How to use types correctly and avoid errors in PDDL A:

In addition to the answer given above, it is important to note that the section :types defines type hierarchy, with the basic type "object" that does not need to be specified. So, in your example, you say that element is a subtype of ele, door is a subtype of dor, etc. So, you will end up with 8 types. Not sure whether that was the intention of your PDDL types section.

An example type system might be:

(:types 
  element - object
  door - element
  location - element
  room - element
 )

Which would produce a hierarchy like:

object
└- element
   ├─ door
   ├- location
   └- room

Q: How can I format a number with commas as thousands separators? A:

The patterns which you and others mentioned here cannot handle numbers like 12345.6789 because of more than three numbers after the decimal point.

This is much simpler and is not buggy:

const number = 12345.6789
const converted = number.toLocaleString('en')
console.log(converted) // Output: 12,345.679
